ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: General overview of research ethics related topics
A broad overview and specific breakdown of responsible conducts of research.
Gain awareness of expectations of research especially as it pertains to copyright, patents, publishing, and funding.
How to do research ethically
About data ownership, patents, plagiarism,...
ethical conduct of research
Yes. I learned a lot about how to do research properly. What are my limits and where I have to be careful
Crucial aspects in conducting research responsibly and according to regulations.
The main red flags for unethical behavior in an academic setting.
research
I learned about how the paper submission is done.
Ethical behavior when conducting research
This requires course gives an overview of some necessary knowledge surrounding research in an academic sense. Topics included interpersonal relationships, patents, IP, etc.

An understanding of what constitutes responsible conduct in research; issues in research ethics at all stages (data collection, authorship, presentation, etc), proper workplace conduct, how to navigate conflicts in workplace.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The scheduling is very inconvenient, right near final SI presentations and final assessments in classes.
I wish it was held in the fall so Master's students can benefit from the education before doing their research/lab work.
It was refreshing to have a series of different instructors for this course.
Strength: Classroom is good
This course should be a requirement in the first semester of a PhD or MS student
I want to hear more examples of misconduct. These examples teach better than listing "what the term data means".
Very Informative
The timely sharing of materials for those who cannot attend in person was very well done, otherwise, I cannot tell.

The course was pretty thorough. However, most people seemed unengaged. The timing of the course (three-hour periods three weeks in a row on a Friday afternoon), the lackadaisical attitude of the lecturers, and the lack of any external assessment made it seem like the course was by rote and didn't have to be taken seriously.
everything is good
None
The information is useful, however the slides could be made a little clearer or concise
Strong, interesting seminar. 3 seminars was enough.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it is necessary for conducting research ethically.
No because it is compulsory
yes, it is very important to know these prior to conduct research
Yes. I learned a lot about how to do research properly
For those in need, I will, especially those who cannot attend in person.
This course is required, but given the option, I would not recommend it.
yes
Yes
This course is not optional.
This course is required for graduate students.
